# Arrange Plots Directly

```{r}
library(ggalign)
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
p1 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_point(aes(mpg, disp)) + 
  ggtitle('Plot 1')

p2 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_boxplot(aes(gear, disp, group = gear)) + 
  ggtitle('Plot 2')

p3 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_point(aes(hp, wt, colour = mpg)) + 
  ggtitle('Plot 3')

p4 <- ggplot(mtcars) + 
  geom_bar(aes(gear)) + 
  facet_wrap(~cyl) + 
  ggtitle('Plot 4')
```

Combine plots directly:
```{r}
align_plots(p1, p2)
```

By row:

```{r}
align_plots(p1, p2, ncol = 1)
```

Align a list of plots:

```{r}
align_plots(!!!list(p1, p2, p3))
```

Set different width for plots:

```{r}
align_plots(p1, p2, widths = c(2, 1))
```

Works for multiple plots:

```{r}
align_plots(p1, p2, p3, p4, ncol = 2, widths = c(2, 1))
```

Set space:

```{r}
align_plots(p1, NULL, p2)
```

More see [Data-Free Composition](https://yunuuuu.github.io/ggalign-book/data-free.html) of ggalign tutorial book.
